channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2024040465
item.description:
Report E-2024040465

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-23T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-18
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a punctured 30-gallon metal drum containing CDR7102FCNA Hardner Type 02 damaged by a nail from a pallet. This resulted in an estimated 1-gallon release of product onto the wooden trailer floor in a 1’x1’ area. A Contractor cleaned-up the release with oil dry, overpacked the damaged drum, and containerized the pallet for waste disposal. One 85-gallon poly drum of waste was generated. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were affected by this incident.

item.title: Report X-2024041047
item.description:
Report X-2024041047

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-23T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/17/2024 at approximately 1900, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 4264197 at the station location in Minneapolis, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shpment consisted of 4 fiberboard boxes, each containing one cylinder. One of the packages was discovered discharging, due to a broken valve. The shipment is being held until all pressure has been depleted and the customer will be contacted for a package pick-up.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded from bottom of trailer 824248. when PH lifted package, he noticed it was wet. QA immediately took package, o0pened it and found that 1 plastic jug had a small puncture in the handle and had released approx. 8 ounces into the box. The box appeared to have absorbed all the released liquid, none was found in the trailer. Box was placed in HAZMAT recovery bucket and processed. DescribePack: Plastic jug had a small pin in the seam on the handle, and the seal was punctured. Unable to determine the cause of the failure. There was absolutely no damage to outer packing or other jugs. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Leaking jug was placed in Hazmat bucket lined with plastic bag and absorb all material in the bottom.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/14/2024 at approximately 2000, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 435751 at the hub facilty in Newark, reporting a consumer commodity spill. The shipment consisted of one plastic jerrican packaged in a fiberboard box. The jerrican appeared to have leaked from the top, resulting in spillage. The cause of the spillage is unknown. Further investigation revealed that the shipment's commoidty was actually UN1170 Ethanon solution, and not ID8000 Consumer commodity. The shipment was classifed incorrectly. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived in QA in a repacked Fedex box that was soaked and discolored. Package had no indication or labeling of hazmat status. Package had been previously DPR'd and poorly repacked at the destination station 62 and returned. It was loosely packed in the box and leaked a significant amount out by the time it arrived at 625. Seeing the package, I checked the SDS for hazmat status where it said it was regulated, UN3264. DescribePack: Cap was on and there is a plug underneath, but the plug appeared to not seal on one side of the hole and was leaking significantly out from under the cap. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately isolated upright in a lined Tote.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package had gotten wet on the bottom from rain, handlers disregarded arrows and placed package upside down, and dropped the package onto the tugger where it was brought to QA. The drop caused the seals on the bottles to burst and caused the cleaner liquid to spill from the caps, package handler had liquid spill onto him. Had first aid for exposure done, no injury report filed. DescribePack: Package had orientation arrows ignored and was dropped on the wrong side, causing the liquid to break the seals within the bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a tote and placed properly following arrows, then was promptly moved into the hazardous cage for inspection.

  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=651287459475 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=Unloading ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1263 CLASS=30 QTY UOM=Liquid - Liter PSN TEXT=PAINT PKG GRP=III SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=4 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Liter MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=A - Metal (any type) NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=1 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=2 - Can TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=1 TOTAL UOM=Liquid - Liter )During sort operations at the OAKH facility a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained six metal cans inside packaged with sytrofoam peanuts for dunnage. One of the six cans was dented causing the lid to come off and spill it's contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was was found on the floor on the driver side of nose. The orientation arrows were not followed. Package was removed from trailer 819655, The package handler that carried the package to the NC belt was not aware that the package was leaking. When the package handler that found the leaking hazmat had relayed that the package was leaking. The hazmat package was on the vertical belt being transfer to the NC belt. The package handler had carried the leaking hazmat to NC belt even though it was communicated. Operations were stopped while in-house cleanup was preformed. DescribePack: The body of the container was cracked along the side with a 1cm line. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Response from ops supervisor to perform inhouse cleanup.

item.title: Report X-2024040860
item.description:
Report X-2024040860

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-08
  • City: LEWISTON
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During a.m. sort, the driver brought the package over to the QA dept and reported it was leaking. This QA personnel placed the item in a tote to contain further leaking outside the package. Further investigation and a SDS was researched. DescribePack: The corners of the package were wet. Upon inspection the inside of the package was saturated. Two bottles each containing 1/2 gallon of epoxy hardener and resin were wet and most of the liquid was around the cap. The bottle of hardener felt lighter than the other container. Unable to determine the cause, when tipped over and examined there were no puncture holes. The liquid had hardened around the cap. The label on the bottles indicated it was hazardous. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The driver brought the package over to the QA dept once observed it was leaking. It was then placed in a tote to contain the leaking. Once identified it was hazardous, it was placed in a red hazmat tote and the processing of the hazmat was initiated.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE METAL PAIL WAS SHIPPED INSIDE A PLASTIC BAG THAT HAD NOT BEEN REMOVED COMPLETELY. THE METAL PAIL HAD BEEN PLACED UPON THE INCOMPATIBLE LINE. WHILE TRAVELING DOWN THE LINE, THE PLASTIC BAG HAD BECOME CAUGHT IN A TRANSITION PLATE, CAUSING THE METAL PAIL TO FALL OFF, BECOMING DENTED AND RELEASING LIQUID CONTENT. THE SPILL HAD BEEN COVERED WITH ABSORBANT PADS AND THE METAL PAIL HAD BEEN COVERED AND MOVED OUT OF REACH OF OTHER EMPLOYEES. DescribePack: Conveyer or Material Handling Equipment Mishap THE METAL PAIL WAS NOT DEFECTIVE IN ANY WAY. IT WAS JUST A SERIES OF UNFORTUNATE EVENTS THAT LED TO THE RELEASE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE METAL PAIL WAS PUT INSIDE A PLASTIC BAG, STANDING UPRIGHT AND COVERED SO THAT THE PAINT FUMES WOULD NOT ESCAPE.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6100
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 03/28/2024, at 1745 hours, personnel in the CSXT Maxwell Yard discovered WCHX 30209, a loaded tank car of acetone, leaking from the top of the tank car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Ineos Phenol Inc, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report # 2024032800201). HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found three of four bolts on the liquid line valve mounting flange were less than tool tight. Contractor personnel tightened the liquid line flange bolts to stop the release and decontaminated the residue material from the side of the tank car. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Marcelles Prather, Marcelles.Prather@Ineos.com, 251-463-6082). The car was held out of Transporation pending additional repair by a certified repair shop or One Time Movement Approval from FRA.

  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted an 8ft-by-50ft area of the trailer floor and a 25ft-by-100ft area of the concrete lot and estimated that seventy-five (75) gallons of material was released from one (1) 275-gallon poly tote. Hepaco personnel deployed a granular absorbent and a neutralizer to the impacted areas. The spent material was gathered and containerized into eight (8) 55-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was transported to the local Dayton Freight terminal and placed in a secure location for the terminal to coordinate disposal. The generated waste will remain onsite for the Dayton Freight team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040396
item.description:
Report E-2024040396

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-15
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCW experienced a release from (4) 275-gallon poly totes. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20-gallons of UN2734 Tri-Act 1800 released from (2) 275-gallon poly totes due to forklift punctures. Approximately 20-gallons of UN2920 Tri-Act 1820 also released from (2) 275-gallon poly totes due to a bent metal cage and a forklift puncture. The products collectively impacted a 6’ x 1’ area of the trailer floor, 20’ x 8’ area of the concrete lot, and a 40’ x 15’ & 10’ x 3’ areas of the concrete dock floor. All 4 totes of material were transferred into new totes for shipment on. Absorbent & citric acid solution were then deployed and worked into the impacted areas to clean and neutralize the release. The damaged totes were then cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents into (8) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On April 11th, a package was observed to have smoke coming out of it during the sort. The package was removed to the outside of the facility in case a full fire erupted. Emergency services were not called to examine the package. Shortly after the smoke lessened and the box was no longer hot to the touch. The package was brought in and examined and it was determined that there were four non-spillable batteries inside, two of which showed scorch marks from a small fire. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and is being help pending disposition. The NRC was notified of the fire at approximately 2300, report # 1396190.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLER WAS PULLING OFF THE BELT, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS WET AND INFORMED THEIR MANAGER. THE MANAGER QUICKLY INFORMED QA OF THE POSSIBLE LEAKING HAZMAT SINCE THE PACKAGE WAS WET. QA GRABBED A TOTE LINED WITH A CLEAR, LARGE HAZMAT BAG AND FOLD ABSORB. THEY RUSHED OVER TO THE AREA AND NOTICED THE PACKAGE IN QUESTION WAS LEAKING CORROSIVE MATERIAL. THEY PLACED THE PACKAGE IN THE TOTE. QA CLEANED UP THE AREA WITH THE FOLD ABSORB MATERIAL. ONCE IT WAS SAFE AND SECURE, THEY BROUGHT THE PACKAGE TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS ON ITS SIDE ON THE IC BELT AND CAUSED THE 5-GALLON CONTAINER TO LEAK OUT THRU THE CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED UP WITH FOLD ABSORB.

  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN ANCHORAGE, ALASKA SIX PACKAGES SHIPPING FROM USA TO HONG KONG WERE INSPECTED PRIOR TO EXPORT. INSPECTION REVEALED MULTIPLE SAMSUNG CELL PHONES IN EACH PACKAGE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS IN THE SHIPMENT ARE 1Z81Y7E86777785250, 1Z81Y7E86777619662, 1Z81Y7E86778945076, 1Z81Y7E86777861480 AND 1Z81Y7E86776468890. TRACKING 1Z81Y7E86777341845 CONTAINS (80) CELL PHONES. TRACKING 1Z81Y7E86777785250 CONTAINS (45) CELL PHONES. TRACKING 1Z81Y7E86777619662 CONTAINS (80) CELL PHONES. TRACKING 1Z81Y7E86778945076 CONTAINS (70) CELL PHONES. TRACKING 1Z81Y7E86777861480 CONTAINS (70) CELL PHONES AND TRACKING 1Z81Y7E86776468890 CONTAINS (67) CELL PHONES. ALL INNER PACKAGES HAVE OLD FEDEX LABELS WITH UN3481 LITHIUM BATTERY MARKINGS APPLIED EXCEPT TRACKING 1Z81Y7E86777785250. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM CALIFORNIA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 81Y7E8, NICE CHOICE INC., 2525 VISTA INDUSTRIA, COMPTON CA 90221-3200.

  • Description: On April 11, 2024, at 0844 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Ashland, Virginia regarding the release of approximately (3) gallons of BLUESKIN LVC ADHESIVE (UN1133, 3, II) from (1) 5-gallon poly drum due to being punctured by a forklift. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release was contained to a 5ft x 8ft area on the trailer floor and cardboard. Contractors were able to clean the release with a multi-purpose remover, absorbents, and the proper PPE. All waste generated was placed in (1) 55-gallon DM and was taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized an 85-gallon open top drum to overpack and contain the damaged 55-gallon drum. ES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer interior and worked them in with hand tools. Crews utilized absorbent pads to wipe the released product off the pallet. All UN1993-impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel closed the valve to prevent further spill. FCE deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and swept them in with hand tools. All UN1719-impacted material was collected and containerized into four (4) 55-gallon poly drums for disposal.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: MONTEBELLO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 5, 2024, three (3) pallets of one-gallon pails of paint were damaged due to improper securement during shipping and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the impacted site. TWE personnel collected and containerized 196 1-gallon pails of UN1263 into five (5) 55-gallon drums and one (1) 95-gallon overpack for disposal purposes. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the trailer floor and worked them in with hand tools. The damaged cardboard and all UN1263 impacted materials were collected and containerized into two (2) 30-gallon drums for disposal purposes.

item.title: Report X-2024040610
item.description:
Report X-2024040610

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package had been unloaded and was on van line ready to be loaded on van when the loading package handler saw that the box was wet. Package was set aside on a spill containment pallet, then placed in a lined container shortly after. DescribePack: 2 of the 4 jugs were packed in the box upside down, with the caps in contact with the bottom of the box. This allowed stress to be applied to caps, leading to them beginning to leak inside the plastic bags. The plastic bags then also began leaking, soiling the box and other contents. The caps had some tape wrapped around them, but this appears to have been ineffective at prevent leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The external box contained mostly all of the spillage, becoming wet in the process. There was no visible wetness on conveyor belt, and only a slightly damp spot of the spill pallet. Spill neutralizer was applied to the spot. Package was placed in a lined container during inspection and reporting. During this, contents began to leak more due to manipulation. All leakage was contained by liner.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: First Call Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft-by-1ft area of the concrete terminal floor and estimated that one (1) ounce of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. First Call Environmental personnel deployed absorbents to the impacted area and recovered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 95-gallon poly drum along with the damaged 55-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040415
item.description:
Report E-2024040415

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-30
  • City: SHERIDAN
  • State: WY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: SKYWEST AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SkyWest Airlines was notified via an Irregular Operations Report of a PED fire/incident that occurred on SkyWest 5079 SHR-DEN on 3/30/24 (CRJ 200/N465SW). The incident occurred prior to boarding in SHR. A passenger’s checked bag was loaded into the cargo pit. The ramp agent loading the bags inside the pit noticed smoke coming from the passenger’s bag. The bag was immediately removed from the aircraft and taken to a safe location. Airport Fire and Rescue was notified and responded. Fire rescue crews neutralized the smoking bag. The passenger was then brought into a private room to speak with TSA and the station’s supervisor on duty to discuss the battery fire. According to the IOR report, it was determined, at that point, that the cause of the smoke was a charger charging what appears to be a battery tray holding possibly four 18650 lithium Ion Batteries. The charred battery/charging device is currently being held by the Airport Fire and Rescue in SHR. I asked the station manager if he could tell if it was a charging device actively charging a battery in the checked bag. The best he could tell, because of the charred nature of the devices, that there may have been a e-cigarette charger that was possibly charging batteries.

item.title: Report X-2024040708
item.description:
Report X-2024040708

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-28
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Conductor reported strong smell of sulfur in the area near the car. Car isolated. Contractor called to respond with H2S meter. Investigation revealed leakage around the manwy cover. Manway was opened and contractor found shipper had placed several gaskets on top of each other, rather than removing the old gaskets. Contractor removed old gaskets and found the original flat gasket still in the manway cover. This gasket was used to seal the car. Once manway bolts tightened, there was no detect on the meter around the manway.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • City: LAKELAND
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 28, 2024, four (4) 1-gallon cans of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Alpha-Omega Training Compliance (AOTC) to remediate the site. Crews downstacked the pallet to find the source of the release, and they found one (1) damaged cardboard box that contained four (4) 1-gallon cans had been crushed, so crews removed the box and its contents for waste. The product had leaked onto the outside of some of the other cardboard boxes, but the product had already dried. One (1) 55-gallon drum that contained the damaged cardboard box, four (4) impacted cans, and PPE was labeled and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. One 55-gallon drum was punctured by a forklift while staged at the STG Logistics facility. Approximately 2 quarts of free liquid were released from the damaged drum to the warehouse floor. Area was secured and Green Charge was contracted to perform the cleanup. Upon arrival, free product was detected on the warehouse floor, and contained to immediate area. Green Charge utilized absorbent material and recovered all product. The damaged drum was overpacked to prevent further incident. Spent absorbents were placed into one 55-gallon drum, pending disposal in accordance with local, state, and federal regulations. There were no injuries or exposures reported.

item.title: Report E-2024040365
item.description:
Report E-2024040365

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-16
  • City: RUSTON
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a roadside release of Kurifloc 7115 from a 275-gallon tote as a result of improper loading / inadequate preparation for transportation. The tote became crushed under falling freight breaking the cap and causing the release during transit. Approximately 10-gallons of product released onto the trailer floor, the asphalt beneath the trailer, and the concrete parking lot. The impact areas include the trailer floor: 4'x4', asphalt beneath the trailer: 2'x8', and concrete parking lot: 3'x20'. A Contractor secured the freight for the trailer to pull into a parking lot where a tote transfer was performed and the trailer floor was neutralized with white vinegar. The transferred tote was loaded onto trailer while the damaged tote was taken by the Contractor to XPO’s Shreveport, LA terminal to be cut-up and containerized for waste disposal. Additionally, one drum containing PPE, impacted oil dry, and impacted absorbent rags was generated for waste disposal. No storm-drains, soil, or waterways were impacted by this incident.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Removing the package away immediately from the PH.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 5, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of hypochlorite solution had a faulty valve and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental & Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted site. E3 personnel utilized absorbent pads and neutralized the impacted-dock floor. The new tote of product was properly labeled and staged onsite for further transport. The damaged 275-gallon tote was deconstructed and placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. All debris and generated waste were collected and containerized into the same one (1) 55-gallon poly drum with the deconstructed tote.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 6, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of sodium hydroxide was crushed in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and adjacent freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel overpacked the damaged pail in one (1) 55-gallon drum, then deployed neutralizer to the release. The crew further remediated the site using absorbent pads. All sodium hydroxide-impacted materials were containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel overpacked the damaged drum in one (1) 95-gallon drum for disposal. The crew utilized cleaners and absorbents to further remediate the trailer.   • Description: While completing a routine 10-Day facility inspection, a Veolia employee noticed a wet spot under a pallet of drums. Upon further inspection the employee noticed a pinhole on the side of the drum approximately 10 inches from the top. Approximately 1 gallon of material leaked from the drum through the pinhole throughout the weekend. The drum was overpacked and the spill was cleaned using oil dry.

item.title: Report X-2024040567
item.description:
Report X-2024040567

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-01
  • City: LEWISTON
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered at the re-pack area at this station. It was brought over to the QA dept for further inspection. The bottom edge was saturated and the closures were open where the package was wet. A search via Spidr indicated it was not in its original packaging and was repacked at the Hart HUB. The contents were researched and examined and found to be leaking. An SDS was obtained and found to be hazardous. The item and its packaging was then placed in a haardous tote and processed as a damaged hazmat. DescribePack: The bottom of the package was wet and open. Inside there were three plastic containers with plastic tape placed over the caps and all three were placed in a plastic bag within the package. The image on Spidr indicates the package was originally larger and totaling 49.00pounds and only had a label indicating it was fragile. One of the three containers conaining cyco platinum ph up had significant volumn missing due to a loose cap that was leaking when the container was flipped upside down. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a hazmat tote once it was discovered that it was hazardous. Proper PPE was donned, and the processing of a damaged hazmat was initiated.

  • City: HOLBROOK
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was loaded onto the van for delivery. At this time the bottom of the box opened up and the product started leaking out. The manager was radioed immediately. The manager came over to the van with rubber gloves on and a red hazmat bin. The box and bucked were placed inside the hazmat bin. DescribePack: The tape had failed on the bottom of the box. Upon inspection saw the bottom of the bucket had a crack in it where the product was leaking out of. The crack was about 6 inches long. The bucket was inside the box without any cushioning on the bottom, sides and top. This left excess room inside the overpack fiberboard box the bucket was shipped in for movement of the bucket inside the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box and bucket were placed inside a red hazmat plastic bucket. This is containing the release of the product.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Large fully regulated hazmat package containing 4 4L glass bottles of methanol. The hazmat was being loaded to a trailer when the bottom of the box opened and one of the glass bottles fell out, completely breaking the bottle and spilling all of liquid. The bottom of the box looked to be glued but it loosened and caused to open when handling and moving box around. Other 3 hazmat glass bottles were undamaged. DescribePack: The box opened up from the bottom due to box possibly not having enough glue or glue not working properly. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat broken pieces were cleaned very carefully and all the liquid it spilled was cleaned with absorbent pads. The broken hazmat and the cleaning gear was placed inside a hazmat bag inside a plastic bin.

item.title: Report X-2024040645
item.description:
Report X-2024040645

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-08
  • City: HOLBROOK
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was unloaded off the trailer. Then the box was transported to the van that was to deliver the box. An hour later, the driver of the van saw the box was leaking white small granules. The driver called a manager who came over to the van with gloves, broom, dustpan and a red hazmat plastic container. The manager put the box inside the red hazmat plastic container and swept up any granules that came out of the box. He then gently put the granules inside the box. The box was then transported to the hazmat cage by the Ops Admin. DescribePack: The bottom of the plastic bucket had a dent on the corner. The dent was about 3" long. The bottom of the plastic bucket has a crack going along the outside seem about 8 inches long. Upon inspection saw underneath this plastic bottom was another plastic bottom. This inside plastic bottom was cracked in several places. The cracks ranged from 7 inches to 3 inches. I could see the product had leaked out of these cracks and the very outside crack. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was turned upside down and placed inside a red plastic hazmat container. The leakage of the product stopped since the cracks were on the bottom of the plastic bucket that was inside the box.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-04
  • City: ELGIN
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 4, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of corrosive liquid was punctured by a forklift and released approximately 115-gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted roadway/trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. HCE utilized an additional tote to complete a gravity feed from the impacted 275-gallon tote. All spent absorbents, absorbent pads and collected waste were collected and containerized into six (6) 55-gallon metal drums and PPE was containerized into a separate 55-gallon open top poly drum. All were labeled and set aside for terminal disposal.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was made aware that there was leaking hazmat on the ground. QA was told that the driver had the package on their truck from the previous day and that when he opened up his side door the package fell out of his truck and onto the ground. The package was put into a plastic lined bin. QA stopped the continued downhill movement of the liquid with absorbent pads. The liquid was tested and came up acidic. Neutralizer was put onto the spill until it came up as non-acidic. Loose particulate was then placed on the spill area to absorb the liquid. DescribePack: The cap was loose on one of the jugs. The cap fell off after the package fell out of the drivers truck. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Neutralizer was used to negate the acid in the liquid. Loose particulate was placed on the spill.

item.title: Report X-2024040525
item.description:
Report X-2024040525

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: SANTA MARIA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package came back to the end of the vanline and it was placed on the floor flush to the back wall of the vanline. The cause of the damage is unknown but the outer box did not indicate it was a hazmat. Inner box had all the necessary markings. DescribePack: upon discovery the outer box had a wet spot on it like it had been dripped down internally. At the time I did not know it was a hazmat as the outer box did not have any markings on it to indicate that it was a hazmat. The inner box had a large wet spot on the top and partially down both sides of the inner box. Other than that there wasnt any other kind of damage to the outer or inner box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once I discovered it was a hazmat I had to run to the sink and thoroughly wash my hands as I had touched the wet part of the box. When I returned I put on nitrile gloves, grabbed a hazmat bag, and put the damaged package into a red lined bin. I then used some absorbent pads to soak up and wipe down the surface area where the box had been located.

item.title: Report X-2024040463
item.description:
Report X-2024040463

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-01
  • City: DURHAM
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came off of truck in Unload notably wet, was placed into lined tote immediately and moved to safe area. Unable to determine if this occurred when initially loaded to trailer or during transit to our station. Upon opening outer packaging found one of four 4L bottles of water (non-hazardous) had somehow broken during shipping causing water to release inside package and eventually seep out as well. DescribePack: There were corrugated moldings around each of the four bottles to help protect during shipping but evidently was not enough to keep one bottle from getting broken. When that happened water leaked out inside, compromising structural integrity of inner, outer packaging and causing the box/moldings to tear and distort due to weight of 3 non-broken bottles. Bottle was already broken coming off of trailer so no knowledge of what directly caused damage to occur. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Water had already leaked out due to bottle being broken completely. Cleaned up all wet areas in trailer and unload to re-establish safe working environment. Thankfully as stated through this report, the box was labeled as a Hazmat but did not contain any hazardous contents. Not sure if it was a mix-up by shipper when assigning labels to packages or what cause was, but no hazardous contents were in package or leaked out.

item.description:
Report X-2024040432

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-30
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLER WAS UNLOADING THE TRAILER, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS WET AND LEAKING. THEY INFORMED THEIR MANAGER OF THE SITUATION AND THEY IN TURN INFORMED QA OF THE PROBLEM. QA GRABBED A TOTE LINED WITH A CLEAR, LARGE HAZMAT BAG AND FOLD ABSORB. THEY RUSHED OVER TO THE AREA AND PLACED THE PACKAGE IN THE TOTE. ONCE THE AREA WAS SECURE, THEY BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AND USED A PH STRIP ON THE PACKAGE AND NOTICED IT WAS HAZARDOUS AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED ON ITS SIDE FOR SHIPPING. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND A PH STRIP WAS USED TO DETERMINE TO SEE IF IT WAS HAZARDOUS. ONCE IT WAS DISCOVERED IT WAS, THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN THE HAZMAT CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

This has lead station personnel to believe the battery was compromised before it was picked up. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: the package was put into a tote and the battery was set upright to reduce the leakage.
